# swagger-java-client

Azure Identity Labs API
- API version: 1.0.0.0
  - Build date: 2021-09-02T18:16:28.209999-05:00[America/Chicago]

No description provided (generated by Swagger Codegen https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-codegen)


*Automatically generated by the [Swagger Codegen](https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-codegen)*


## Requirements

Building the API client library requires:
1. Java 1.7+
2. Maven/Gradle

## Installation

To install the API client library to your local Maven repository, simply execute:

```shell
mvn clean install
```

To deploy it to a remote Maven repository instead, configure the settings of the repository and execute:

```shell
mvn clean deploy
```

Refer to the [OSSRH Guide](http://central.sonatype.org/pages/ossrh-guide.html) for more information.

### Maven users

Add this dependency to your project's POM:

```xml
<dependency>
  <groupId>io.swagger</groupId>
  <artifactId>swagger-java-client</artifactId>
  <version>1.0.0</version>
  <scope>compile</scope>
</dependency>
```

### Gradle users

Add this dependency to your project's build file:

```groovy
compile "io.swagger:swagger-java-client:1.0.0"
```

### Others

At first generate the JAR by executing:

```shell
mvn clean package
```

Then manually install the following JARs:

* `target/swagger-java-client-1.0.0.jar`
* `target/lib/*.jar`

## Getting Started

Please follow the [installation](#installation) instruction and execute the following Java code:

```java
import io.swagger.client.*;
import io.swagger.client.auth.*;
import io.swagger.client.model.*;
import io.swagger.client.api.AppApi;

import java.io.File;
import java.util.*;

public class AppApiExample {

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        
        AppApi apiInstance = new AppApi();
        String appid = "appid_example"; // String | Provide the Application ID (GUID format) to query Lab App Info
        try {
            List<AppInfo> result = apiInstance.apiAppAppidGet(appid);
            System.out.println(result);
        } catch (ApiException e) {
            System.err.println("Exception when calling AppApi#apiAppAppidGet");
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}
import io.swagger.client.*;
import io.swagger.client.auth.*;
import io.swagger.client.model.*;
import io.swagger.client.api.AppApi;

import java.io.File;
import java.util.*;

public class AppApiExample {

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        
        AppApi apiInstance = new AppApi();
        String apptype = "cloud"; // String | Allowed Values :  \"cloud\", \"onprem\"
        String appplatform = "web"; // String | Allowed Values :  \"web\", \"spa\"
        String azureenvironment = "azurecloud"; // String | Allowed Values :  \"azureb2ccloud\", \"azurechinacloud\", \"azurecloud\", \"azuregermanycloud\", \"azureppe\", \"azureusgovernment\"
        String signinaudience = "azureadmultipleorgs"; // String | Allowed Values :  \"azureadmyorg\", \"azureadmultipleorgs\", \"azureadandpersonalmicrosoftaccount\"
        String isadminconsented = "yes"; // String | Allowed Values :  \"yes\", \"no\"
        String publicclient = "yes"; // String | Allowed Values :  \"yes\", \"no\"
        try {
            List<AppInfo> result = apiInstance.apiAppGet(apptype, appplatform, azureenvironment, signinaudience, isadminconsented, publicclient);
            System.out.println(result);
        } catch (ApiException e) {
            System.err.println("Exception when calling AppApi#apiAppGet");
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}
```

## Documentation for API Endpoints

All URIs are relative to */*

Class | Method | HTTP request | Description
------------ | ------------- | ------------- | -------------
*AppApi* | [**apiAppAppidGet**](docs/AppApi.md#apiAppAppidGet) | **GET** /api/App/{appid} | Gets App Info based on App ID
*AppApi* | [**apiAppGet**](docs/AppApi.md#apiAppGet) | **GET** /api/App | Gets App Info based on Azure Environment or Sign-in Audience
*ConfigApi* | [**apiConfigGet**](docs/ConfigApi.md#apiConfigGet) | **GET** /api/Config | Gets the Lab Configurartion (User/App/Lab) Based on Query Parameters with predefined defaults.   You can override the defaults.
*ConfigApi* | [**apiConfigUpnGet**](docs/ConfigApi.md#apiConfigUpnGet) | **GET** /api/Config/{upn} | Gets a single Lab User Config with Lab and App Info based on UPN
*CreateTempUserApi* | [**apiCreateTempUserPost**](docs/CreateTempUserApi.md#apiCreateTempUserPost) | **POST** /api/CreateTempUser | Let&#x27;s you create a temp (a.k.a LOCKED USER) CLOUD User for testing purposes.   All users created by this API will be auto-deleted after 90 minutes.
*DeleteDeviceApi* | [**apiDeleteDeviceDelete**](docs/DeleteDeviceApi.md#apiDeleteDeviceDelete) | **DELETE** /api/DeleteDevice | Delete&#x27;s a Device from AAD.   You need to provide the UPN and the Device ID (in GUID format) in Query String.
*DisablePolicyApi* | [**apiDisablePolicyPut**](docs/DisablePolicyApi.md#apiDisablePolicyPut) | **PUT** /api/DisablePolicy | lets you disable CA/Special Policies for any Locked User
*EnablePolicyApi* | [**apiEnablePolicyPut**](docs/EnablePolicyApi.md#apiEnablePolicyPut) | **PUT** /api/EnablePolicy | lets you enable CA/Special Policies for any Locked User
*LabApi* | [**apiLabLabnameGet**](docs/LabApi.md#apiLabLabnameGet) | **GET** /api/Lab/{labname} | Gets Lab Info based on Lab Name
*LabAvailabilityApi* | [**apiLabAvailabilityGet**](docs/LabAvailabilityApi.md#apiLabAvailabilityGet) | **GET** /api/LabAvailability | Will give you the current status of the labs
*LabPolicyInfoApi* | [**apiLabPolicyInfoGet**](docs/LabPolicyInfoApi.md#apiLabPolicyInfoGet) | **GET** /api/LabPolicyInfo | Will give you the different Policies available to be used with Create Temp User / Enable/Disable Policy API
*LabSecretApi* | [**apiLabSecretGet**](docs/LabSecretApi.md#apiLabSecretGet) | **GET** /api/LabSecret | Gets the Lab Secret from Identity Labs Secret (msidlabs) KeyVault.   You need to provide the secret in Query String.
*LabUserSecretApi* | [**apiLabUserSecretGet**](docs/LabUserSecretApi.md#apiLabUserSecretGet) | **GET** /api/LabUserSecret | Use LabSecret EndPoint Instead of this. This will be deprecated end of March 2020  You need to provide the secret in Query String.
*ResetApi* | [**apiResetPut**](docs/ResetApi.md#apiResetPut) | **PUT** /api/Reset | Resets MFA/Password for a lab test user based on UPN.   You need to provide the UPN and Operation(MFA/Password) in Query String.
*TempUserInfoApi* | [**apiTempUserInfoGet**](docs/TempUserInfoApi.md#apiTempUserInfoGet) | **GET** /api/TempUserInfo | Let&#x27;s you query for Locked Users and get user specific details.
*UserApi* | [**apiUserGet**](docs/UserApi.md#apiUserGet) | **GET** /api/User | Gets the Lab User(s) Based on Query Parameters with predefined defaults.   You can override the defaults.
*UserApi* | [**apiUserUpnGet**](docs/UserApi.md#apiUserUpnGet) | **GET** /api/User/{upn} | Gets a single Lab User based on UPN

## Recommendation

It's recommended to create an instance of `ApiClient` per thread in a multithreaded environment to avoid any potential issues.
